intro: Heliopsis anomala, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright yellow to orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Heliopsis anomala is often found in open woodlands, grasslands, and along stream banks.
